SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

xxl.core.indexStructures
Class Tree

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
Direct Known Subclasses:
ORTree
public abstract class Tree
extends Object

The Tree-class is a generic and highly flexible super-class that implements features used by grow- and post-trees. It has the following inner classes:

  • interface Descriptor
  • class IndexEntry
  • class Node
  • class Query
A tree consists of nodes which store entries. The entries of inner nodes (index nodes) are index entries which refer to (sub-)nodes. See following figure:

Each index entry has got a descriptor describing the data range represented by the subnode refered to by the index entry. For instance, in a B-tree the descriptor is a simple separator key, but in a R-tree the descriptor is a spatial rectangle.
To use this class you have to implement the inner interface Descriptor and to inherit from the inner class Node (which represents leaf- and non-leaf nodes). You may also have to inherit from other inner classes like IndexEntry in order to align them with your application or to obtain more efficiency. The structure of this class, including all abstract methods, is as follows: 

        public abstract class Tree {
                public abstract Node createNode(int level);
 
                public static interface Descriptor extends Cloneable {
                        public abstract boolean overlaps (Descriptor descriptor);
                        public abstract boolean contains (Descriptor descriptor);
                        public abstract void union (Descriptor descriptor);
                        public abstract boolean equals (Object object);
                        public abstract Object clone ();
                }

                protected class IndexEntry {
                }

                protected abstract class Node {
                        public class SplitInfo {
                        }
                        protected abstract SplitInfo initialize (Object entry);
                        public abstract Iterator entries ();
                        protected abstract int number ();
                        public abstract Iterator descriptors (Descriptor nodeDescriptor);
                        public abstract Iterator query (Descriptor queryDescriptor);
                        protected abstract IndexEntry chooseSubtree (Descriptor descriptor, Stack path);
                        protected abstract void grow (Object data, Stack path);
                        protected abstract SplitInfo split (Stack path);
                        protected abstract void post (SplitInfo splitInfo, IndexEntry newIndexEntry);
                }

                public abstract class Query implements Iterator {
                        protected static class Candidate {
                        }
                        protected Iterator expand (Candidate parent, Node node){
                        }
                }
        }

Nested Class Summary
 class Tree.IndexEntry
          This class describes the index entries (i.e. the entries of the non-leaf nodes) of a tree.
 class Tree.Node
          Node is the class used to represent leaf- and non-leaf nodes.
 class Tree.Query
          Queries on the Tree are evaluated lazily (ONC).

Field Detail

getDescriptor

public Function getDescriptor
Returns the Descriptor of a given data item.
Function: Object -> Descriptor.

determineContainer

public Function determineContainer
Returns the Containerused to store a new Node created by a split operation.
Function: Tree.Node.SplitInfo -> Container,
Tree.Node.SplitInfo: information on the split. If the Container of a new root has to be determined, then splitInfo.path.isEmpty() == true.

getContainer

public Function getContainer
Returns the Container that is used to store the node the IndexEntry is pointing to.
Function: Tree.IndexEntry -> Container

overflows

public Predicate overflows
Checks if a Node overflows.

underflows

public Predicate underflows
Checks if a Node underflows.

getSplitMinRatio

public Function getSplitMinRatio
Returns the minimal relative number of entries which the Node may contain after a split. The point of reference is assumed to be the number of entries of the Node that was split (before the split).
Function: Tree.Node -> double

getSplitMaxRatio

public Function getSplitMaxRatio
Returns the maximal relative number of entries which the Node may contain after a split. The point of reference is assumed to be the number of entries of the node that was split (before the split).
Function: Tree.Node -> double

rootEntry

protected Tree.IndexEntry rootEntry
This is a reference on the root node of the tree. NOTE: if rootEntry contains a descriptor it will be ignored by the algorithms of Tree.

See Also:
rootDescriptor

protected Descriptor rootDescriptor
The Descriptor of the tree.

Method Detail

initialize

public Tree initialize(Tree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                       Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                       Function getDescriptor,
                       Function getContainer,
                       Function determineContainer,
                       Predicate underflows,
                       Predicate overflows,
                       Function getSplitMinRatio,
                       Function getSplitMaxRatio)
This is the basic method to create a new tree. It is not sufficient to call the constructor. Before the tree is usable, it must be initialized.

Parameters:
rootEntry - the new rootEntry
rootDescriptor - the new rootDescriptor
getDescriptor - the new getDescriptor
getContainer - the new getContainer
determineContainer - the new determineContainer
underflows - the new underflows
overflows - the new overflows
getSplitMinRatio - the new getSplitMinRatio
getSplitMaxRatio - the new getSplitMaxRatio
Returns:
the initialized tree (i.e. return this)

initialize

public Tree initialize(Tree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                       Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                       Function getDescriptor,
                       Container container,
                       int minCapacity,
                       int maxCapacity)
Calls the method initialize(Tree.IndexEntry, Descriptor, Function, Function, Function, Predicate, Predicate, Function, Function) to initialize the tree. Both Function objects getContainer and determineContainer are initialized with constant functions always returning the given Container. The Predicate underflows is initialized with: 

                        new Predicate () {
                                public boolean invoke (Object node) {
                                        return ((Tree.Node)node).number() < minCapacity; 
                                }
                        }
The Predicate overflows is initialized with: 

                        new Predicate () {
                                public boolean invoke (Object node) {
                                        return ((Tree.Node)node).number() > maxCapacity; 
                                }
                        }
getSplitMinRatio is defined as: 

                                new Function () {
                                        public Object invoke (Object node) {
                                                return new Double(minCapacity/(double)((Tree.Node)node).number());
                                        }
                                }
getSplitMaxRatio is defined as: 

                        new Function () {
                                public Object invoke (Object node) {
                                        return new Double(1.0-minCapacity/(double)((Tree.Node)node).number());
                                }
                        }

Parameters:
rootEntry - the new rootEntry
rootDescriptor - the new rootDescriptor
getDescriptor - the new getDescriptor
container - used as constant for the new determineContainer
minCapacity - is used to define underflows, getSplitMinRatio and getSplitMaxRatio
maxCapacity - is used to define overflows
Returns:
the initialized tree

initialize

public Tree initialize(Tree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                       Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                       Function getDescriptor,
                       Container container,
                       int innerNodeMinCapacity,
                       int innerNodeMaxCapacity,
                       int leafMinCapacity,
                       int leafMaxCapacity)
Calls the method initialize(Tree.IndexEntry, Descriptor, Function, Function, Function, Predicate, Predicate, Function, Function) to initialize the tree. Both Function objects getContainer and determineContainer are initialized with constant functions always returning the given Container. The Predicate underflows is initialized with: 

                        new Predicate () {
                                public boolean invoke (Object node) {
                                        Tree.Node treeNode = (Node) node;
                                        return treeNode.number() < (treeNode.level()==0 ? leafMinCapacity : innerNodeMinCapacity);
                                }
                        }
The Predicate overflows is initialized with: 

                        new Predicate () {
                                public boolean invoke (Object node) {
                                        Tree.Node treeNode = (Node) node;
                                        return treeNode.number() > (treeNode.level()==0 ? leafMaxCapacity : innerNodeMaxCapacity);
                                }
                        }
getSplitMinRatio is defined as: 

                        new Function () {
                                public Object invoke (Object node) {
                                        Tree.Node treeNode = (Node) node;
                                        return new Double((treeNode.level()==0 ? leafMinCapacity : innerNodeMinCapacity)/(double)treeNode.number());
                                }
                        }
getSplitMaxRatio is defined as: 

                        new Function () {
                                public Object invoke (Object node) {
                                        Tree.Node treeNode = (Node) node;
                                        return new Double(1.0-(treeNode.level()==0 ? leafMinCapacity : innerNodeMinCapacity)/(double)treeNode.number());
                                }
                        }

Parameters:
rootEntry - the new rootEntry
rootDescriptor - the new rootDescriptor
getDescriptor - the new getDescriptor
container - used as constant for the new determineContainer
innerNodeMinCapacity - is used to define underflows, getSplitMinRatio and getSplitMaxRatio for inner nodes
innerNodeMaxCapacity - is used to define overflows for inner nodes
leafMinCapacity - is used to define underflows, getSplitMinRatio and getSplitMaxRatio for leaf nodes
leafMaxCapacity - is used to define overflows for leaf nodes
Returns:
the initialized tree
Since:
1.1

initialize

public Tree initialize(Tree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                       Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                       Function getDescriptor,
                       int blockSize,
                       Container container,
                       int dataSize,
                       int descriptorSize,
                       double minMaxFactor)
Before the tree is usable, it must be initialized. This version of initialize takes basic informations about the size of the blocks and entries and calculates the capacity of inner and leaf nodes.

Parameters:
rootEntry - the new rootEntry
rootDescriptor - the new rootDescriptor
getDescriptor - the new getDescriptor
blockSize - the size of a block of the container in bytes
container - used as constant for the new determineContainer
dataSize - the size of an data object in bytes
descriptorSize - the size of a Descriptor returned by getDescriptor in bytes
minMaxFactor - the quotient between minimum and maximum number of entries in an node, e.g. 0.5
Returns:
the initialized tree
Since:
1.1

                       Container container,
                       int innerNodeMinCapacity,
                       int innerNodeMaxCapacity,
                       int leafMinCapacity,
                       int leafMaxCapacity)

                                return initialize(null, null, getDescriptor, container, innerNodeMinCapacity, innerNodeMaxCapacity, leafMinCapacity, leafMaxCapacity);

Parameters:
getDescriptor - the new getDescriptor
container - the new determineContainer
innerNodeMinCapacity - is used to define underflows, getSplitMinRatio and getSplitMaxRatio for inner nodes
innerNodeMaxCapacity - is used to define overflows for inner nodes
leafMinCapacity - is used to define underflows, getSplitMinRatio and getSplitMaxRatio for leaf nodes
leafMaxCapacity - is used to define overflows for leaf nodes
Returns:
the initialized tree
Since:
1.1

descriptor

public Descriptor descriptor(Object entry)
Returns the Descriptor of a given entry. If this entry itself is a descriptor it is returned, else the Function getDescriptor is used to determine the descriptor of the entry 

                                getDescriptor.invoke(entry)

Parameters:
entry - the entry whose Descriptor is to be determined
Returns:
the descriptor of entry

contains

public boolean contains(Object data)
Tests if a given object is contained in the tree. The method query(Object) is used to find the pages that may contain this object.

Parameters:
data - the object to search for
Returns:
true if the tree contains the given object data
See Also:
query(Object)

get

public Object get(Descriptor descriptor)
Searches for the objects stored in the tree with a given Descriptor.

Parameters:
descriptor - specifies the query
Returns:
the first object returned by query(Descriptor). The result is null if the result of query(Descriptor) is empty
See Also:
Descriptor, query(Descriptor)

insert

protected void insert(Object data,
                      Descriptor descriptor,
                      int targetLevel)
Inserts an object into a given level of the tree. If level>0 data has to be an index entry (This only makes sense for trees whose index nodes support Node.grow()).

Parameters:
data - the data to insert
descriptor - is used to find the node into which data must be inserted
targetLevel - is the tree-level into which data has to be inserted (targetLevel==0 means insert into the suitable leaf node)

insert

public void insert(Object entry,
                   int level)
Inserts an object into a given level of the tree. This method calls insert(Object,int) in the following way: 

                        insert(entry, descriptor(entry), level);

Parameters:
entry - the object that is to be inserted
level - the target level of the insertion operation (leaf-level= 0)
See Also:
insert(Object,Descriptor,int)

insert

public void insert(Object data)
Inserts an object into the leaf-level of the tree. This method calls insert(Object,Descriptor,int) in the following way: 

                                insert(data, (Descriptor)getDescriptor.invoke(data), 0);

Parameters:
data - the object that is to be inserted
See Also:
insert(Object,Descriptor,int)

update

public void update(Object oldData,
                   Object newData)
Overwrites the oldData in the tree by the Object newData.

Parameters:
oldData - the object (in the tree) which has to be replaced
newData - the object which should replace oldData

update

public void update(Descriptor descriptor,
                   Object newData)
This method is akin to update(Object,Object). Here the descriptor of the old data object is used to find the old object.

Parameters:
descriptor - the Descriptor of the object which has to be updated
newData - the object which should replace the old object
See Also:
update(Object,Object)

remove

public Object remove(Descriptor descriptor,
                     int targetLevel,
                     Predicate test)
Removes the object which is specified by the given descriptor. First query is called. 
 
                Iterator objects = query(descriptor, targetLevel);
Then the first object contained of the Iterator which meets test is removed from the tree and returned.

Parameters:
descriptor - specifies the query
targetLevel - the level on which the query has to stop
test - a predicate the object to remove has to fulfill
Returns:
the removed object or null if there was no such object

remove

public Object remove(Object data,
                     Predicate equals)
Calls remove(Descriptor, int, Predicate) whereas the target level is set to zero. The used Descriptor is the result of 

                                getDescriptor.invoke(data);

Parameters:
data - object to remove
equals - predicate determining if an object in the tree equals data and should therefor be removed
Returns:
the removed object or null if no object was removed
See Also:
remove(Descriptor, int, Predicate)

remove

public Object remove(Object data)
Calls remove(Object,Predicate) whereas the default Equal Predicate is used.

Parameters:
data - the object which has to be removed
Returns:
the removed object or null if no such object was found
See Also:
remove(Object,Predicate)

clear

public void clear()
Removes all entries of the tree.

chooseLeaf

protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseLeaf(Descriptor descriptor,
                                     int targetLevel,
                                     Stack path)
This method is used to find the node whose descriptor overlaps the given descriptor. The search stops at the given level.

Parameters:
descriptor - specifies the search target
targetLevel - the level on which the search operation has to be stopped
path - is a stack used to store the path from the root to the node NOTE: entries in the stack have to be instances of Map.Entry whereas the nodes on the path are used as content objects and the index entries as keys.
Returns:
the IndexEntry which references the mentioned node
See Also:
Tree.IndexEntry.chooseSubtree(Descriptor, Stack)

chooseLeaf

protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseLeaf(Object object,
                                     int targetLevel,
                                     Stack path)
Finds the node on the given level, in whose subtree the given object should be contained. If the target level is zero the search process stops on the leaves level.

Parameters:
object - the object to search for
targetLevel - the level at which the search process must stop
path - is a stack used to store the path from the root to the found node NOTE: entries in the stack have to be instances of Map.Entry whereas the nodes on the path are used as content objects and the index entries as keys.
Returns:
the index entry which refers to the mentioned node
See Also:
chooseLeaf(Descriptor, int, Stack)

chooseLeaf

public Tree.IndexEntry chooseLeaf(Object object,
                                  int targetLevel)
Finds the node on the given level, in whose subtree the given object should be contained. If the target level is zero the search process stops on the leaves level.

Parameters:
object - the object searched for
targetLevel - the level on which the search process must stop
Returns:
the index entry which refers to the mentioned node
See Also:
chooseLeaf(Descriptor,int)

post

protected void post(Stack path)
This method repairs the tree if an overflow occurs.

Parameters:
path - the path from the root to the overflowing node

grow

protected Map.Entry grow(Object entry)
This method is called when the root node overflows. In this case the root node has to be splitted and a new root node has to be created. The tree's height increases by one. Also the new root node is written into the container.

Parameters:
entry - the entry which should be inserted to the new root node. This usually is the old rootEntry.
Returns:
a MapEntry whose key is the new rootEntry and whose value is the new root node

indexEntry

protected Tree.IndexEntry indexEntry(Stack path)
Takes the next Entry of the Stack and returns the index entry which refers to the node. NOTE: The method uses peek() to get the next object from the stack. That means that the object is not removed from the stack.

Parameters:
path - a stack which stores a path of the tree NOTE: entries in the stack have to be instances of Map.Entry whereas the nodes on the path are used as content objects and the index entries as keys.
Returns:
the index entry which refers to the next node of the path or null if path is empty

node

protected Tree.Node node(Stack path)
Takes the next Entry of the Stack and gets its node. NOTE: The method use peek() to get the next object from the stack. That means that the object is not removed from the stack.

Parameters:
path - a stack which stores a path of the tree NOTE: entries in the stack have to be instances of Map.Entry whereas the nodes on the path are used as content objects and the index entries as keys.
Returns:
the node of the next entry of path or null if path is empty

level

protected int level(Stack path)
Determines the depth of the given path. This is the height of the tree if the path is empty or the level of to top node on the stack.

Parameters:
path - the path whose depth is requested
Returns:
the level of the node on the top of the stack or height() if the path is empty

down

protected Tree.Node down(Stack path,
                         Tree.IndexEntry indexEntry)
Adds the node to which indexEntry refers to the path. Let node be the node to which indexEntry refers. First a new MapEntry is created: 

                        new MapEntry(indexEntry, node),
Then it is pushed into the Stack path.

Parameters:
path - a Stack which stores a path of the tree. NOTE: The Stack's entries must be objects of the Map.Entry whereas the nodes on the path are used as content objects and the index entries as keys.
indexEntry - the index entry which has to added to the path
Returns:
the node which is assigned to the indexEntry

update

protected void update(Stack path)
Refreshes the top entry of the stack. This entry is an MapEntry (IndexEntry,Node). This association is refreshed in the underlaying container by calling {Tree.IndexEntry#update(Node)}. The stack remains unchanged.

Parameters:
path - the stack whose top entry has to be refreshed
See Also:
Tree.IndexEntry.update(Tree.Node)

up

protected Tree.IndexEntry up(Stack path,
                             boolean unfix)
Is used to traverse the path bottom-up. One call causes the removal of the first path entry from the stack by calling Stack.pop(). If unfix is true the removed index entry will be unfixed in the underlaying container. Finally, the index entry is returned.

Parameters:
path - the path to traverse
unfix - signals if the node associated to the index entry has to be unfixed in the underlaying container
Returns:
the index entry on the top of the path or null if the stack was empty

up

protected Tree.IndexEntry up(Stack path)
Is used to traverse the path bottom-up. One call causes the removal of the first path entry from the stack by calling Stack.pop(). The removed index entry is unfixed in the underlaying container. Finally the index entry is returned.

Parameters:
path - the path to traverse
Returns:
the index entry on top of the path or null if the stack was empty
See Also:
up(Stack,boolean)

query

public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor,
                    int targetLevel)
This method is an implemtation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all objects whose descriptors overlap the given queryDescriptor.

Parameters:
queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a descriptor
targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

query

public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor)
This method is an implemtation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy cursor pointing to all leaf entries whose descriptors overlap with the given queryDescriptor.

Parameters:
queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a descriptor
Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects
See Also:
query(Descriptor, int)

query

public Cursor query(int level)
This method executes a query unsing the rootDescriptor on a given level. That means, that the respose consists of all entries of the given level.

Parameters:
level - the target level of the query
Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

query

public Cursor query()
This method executes a query unsing the rootDescriptor on the leaf level. That means, that the respose consists of all leaf entries (i.e. data objects) stored in the tree.

Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

query

public Cursor query(Object data)
This method executes a query using the descriptor of the given data object on the leaf-level. Thereafter the result of the query is filtered by the following Predicate: 

                                new Predicate () {
                                        public boolean invoke (Object entry) {
                                                return entry.equals(data);
                                        }
                                }
          
 That means, that the respose consists of all leaf entries (i.e. data objects) which equal the
 given data object and whose descriptors overlap with its descriptor.





Parameters:
data - object to search for

Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

query

public Iterator query(Queue queue,
                      int level)
Query to a given level using a priority queue. The method returns a new Query object. 

                                return new Query(queue,level);

Parameters:
queue - the priority queue
level - the target level of the query
Returns:
a lazy Iterator pointing to all response objects. The order is defined by the queue
See Also:
Tree.Query

query

public Iterator query(Queue queue)
Query to the leaf level using a priority queue.

Parameters:
queue - the priority queue
Returns:
a lazy Iterator pointing to all response objects. The order is defined by the queue.
See Also:
Tree.Query
